intro: Cissampelos pareira var. gardneri, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Its roots contain alkaloids and have been used for their purported medicinal properties. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
